bill_title: require that certain financial information concerning fund balances be reported to the Legislature.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require that certain financial information concerning fund balances be reported to the Legislature. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 4-4 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The commissioner of the Bureau of Finance and Management shall report, within the first quarter of each fiscal year, to the government operations and audit committee and the special committee created by chapter 4-8A, the unreserved balance, as of June thirtieth, for each fund in the state treasury that receives indirect cost reimbursements from the federal government. The commissioner shall also identify fund balance designations and commitments for each fund. 300 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.029 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

bill_versions.bill_version: House Government Operations and Audit Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require that certain financial information concerning fund balances be reported to the Legislature. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 4-4 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The commissioner of the Bureau of Finance and Management shall report, upon request, a condition statement for any fund that receives funding from the federal government. 300 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.029 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

bill_versions.bill_version: Senate Government Operations and Audit Engrossed
bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require that certain financial information concerning fund balances be reported to the Legislature. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 4-4 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The commissioner of the Bureau of Finance and Management shall report, upon request, a condition statement for any fund that receives funding from the federal government. The commissioner of the Bureau of Finance and Management shall provide condition statements when requested by a legislative committee or a legislative committee chair. Section 2. That chapter 4-7 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: For the purposes of this chapter, a condition statement is a document that identifies a fund's beginning balance, receipts, disbursements, and ending balance for each of the last two concluded fiscal years and that identifies a fund's beginning balance, projected receipts, projected disbursements, and ending balance for the current fiscal year and the next fiscal year. The fund's ending balance, for the current fiscal year and the next fiscal year, shall represent the ending cash balance of the fund reduced by any money that is reappropriated to the next fiscal year along with any other commitments to be funded from the ending cash balance. Condition statement forms, prescribed by the Bureau of Finance and Management, shall be uniform.
